text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the command of God our Savior and Christ Jesus our hope,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Timothy, my true child in the faith:
Grace, mercy, and peace from God our Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: As I urged you while I was going to Macedonia, remain in Ephesus so that you may command certain men not to teach any different doctrines
speaker: Narrator

text: or pay any attention to myths and endless genealogies that bring about aimless speculations rather than God’s plan, which centers in faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: The goal of this command is love that comes from a pure heart, from a good conscience, and from a sincere faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: By veering away from these things, some have turned aside into meaningless talk.
speaker: Narrator

text: They want to be teachers of the law, although they do not comprehend what they are saying or the things they so strongly affirm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, we know that the law is good as long as one uses it correctly—
speaker: Narrator

text: keeping in mind that the law is not laid down for a righteous person, but for lawless and rebellious people, for godless people and sinners, for unholy and worldly people, for those who kill their fathers and those who kill their mothers, for murderers,
speaker: Narrator

text: for sexually immoral people, for homosexuals, for kidnappers, for liars, for perjurers, and for whatever else is opposed to sound teaching—
speaker: Narrator

text: in keeping with the glorious gospel of the blessed God, with which I was entrusted.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give thanks to the one who empowered me, namely, Christ Jesus our Lord, that he treated me as trustworthy, appointing me into his ministry.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did this even though formerly I was a blasphemer, a persecutor, and a violent man. But I was shown mercy, because I acted ignorantly in unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of our Lord overflowed on me along with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: This saying is trustworthy and worthy of full acceptance: “Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners,” of whom I am the worst.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I was shown mercy for this reason: that in me, the worst sinner, Christ Jesus might demonstrate his unlimited patience as an example for those who are going to believe in him, resulting in eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to the King eternal, to the immortal, invisible, only God, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am entrusting this instruction to you, Timothy, my child, according to the prophecies about you, which were made earlier, so that by them you may fight the good fight,
speaker: Narrator

text: with faith and a good conscience. By rejecting these, some people have suffered shipwreck with regard to their faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: including Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I handed over to Satan so that they might be taught not to blaspheme.
speaker: Narrator

text: First of all, then, I urge that petitions, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings be made for all people,
speaker: Narrator

text: for kings and all those who are in authority, in order that we might live a quiet and peaceful life in all godliness and dignity.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is good and pleasing in the sight of God our Savior,
speaker: Narrator

text: who wants all people to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is one God and one mediator between God and mankind, the man Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who gave himself as a ransom for all, the testimony given at the proper time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this testimony, I was appointed a herald and an apostle—I speak the truth; I am not lying—a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I want the men in every place to pray, lifting up holy hands without anger or argument.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise, I also want women to adorn themselves with respectable clothing, with modesty and self-control, not with braided hair, gold, pearls, or expensive clothes,
speaker: Narrator

text: but with what is proper for women who profess godliness—with good works.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman should learn in a quiet manner with full submission.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I do not permit a woman to teach or to have authority over a man. Instead, she is to continue in a quiet manner.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Adam was formed first, then Eve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was not Adam who was deceived, but it was the woman who was deceived and became a transgressor.
speaker: Narrator

text: But she will be saved—while bearing children—if they remain in faith and love and sanctification with self-control.
speaker: Narrator

text: This saying is trustworthy: If anyone aspires to become an overseer, he desires a noble task.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is necessary, then, for the overseer to be above reproach, the husband of only one wife, temperate, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, able to teach,
speaker: Narrator

text: not a drunkard, not a violent man but gentle, not quarrelsome, not a lover of money.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is necessary that he manage his own household well, with all dignity making sure that his children obey him.
speaker: Narrator

text: (If a man does not know how to manage his own household, how will he take care of God’s church?)
speaker: Narrator

text: He must not be a recent convert, or he might become conceited and fall into the same condemnation as the Devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: In addition, he must have a good reputation with those outside the church, so that he may not fall into disgrace and the Devil’s trap.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, it is necessary that deacons be dignified, not deceitful, not devoted to much wine, not greedy for dishonest gain—
speaker: Narrator

text: men who hold on to the mystery of the faith with a clean conscience.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them also be tested first. Then let them serve as deacons, if they are found to be blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way women must be worthy of respect, not slanderers, temperate, faithful in everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let each deacon be the husband of only one wife, managing his children and his own household well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly, those who serve well as deacons gain for themselves good standing and great boldness in the faith they have in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am writing these things to you even though I hope to come to you shortly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I am delayed, I wanted you to know how it is necessary to behave in God’s household, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and foundation of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Undeniably, great is the mystery of godliness:
He was revealed in flesh,
was justified in spirit,
was seen by messengers,
was preached among the nations,
was believed on in the world,
was taken up in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit clearly says that, in later times, some will fall away from the faith, because they devote themselves to deceitful spirits and the doctrines of demons,
speaker: Narrator

text: in connection with the hypocrisy of liars, whose own consciences have been seared.
speaker: Narrator

text: They forbid people to marry and order them to abstain from foods that God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, everything created by God is good, and nothing is to be rejected if it is received with thanksgiving,
speaker: Narrator

text: because it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you point out these things to the brothers, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, nourished by the words of the faith and the good doctrine, which you have followed faithfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pay no attention to worldly and absurd myths, but train yourself for godliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For bodily training is beneficial to an extent, but godliness is beneficial in all things, because it holds promise both for life now and for the life to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: This saying is trustworthy and worthy of all acceptance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, it is for this reason that we work hard and are insulted: because we have put our hope in the living God, who is the Savior of all people, especially of those who believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Insist on these things and continue teaching them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no one look down on your youth. Instead, be an example for the believers in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, and in purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I come, devote yourself to the reading of Scripture, to encouraging, and to teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you by prophecy when the elders laid their hands on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Practice these things. Constantly be involved in them, so that everyone may see your progress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pay close attention to yourself and to the doctrine. Persevere in them, because by doing this you will save both yourself and those who listen to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not rebuke an older man harshly, but encourage him as a father, younger men as brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: older women as mothers, younger women as sisters, with all purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor widows who are truly widows.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any widow has children or grandchildren, let them first learn to be devoted to their own household and repay their parents, for this is pleasing in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the widow who is without relatives has put her hope in God and continues in her petitions and prayers night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the widow who lives only for her own pleasure is dead, even while she lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Insist on these things also, in order that they may be above criticism.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if anyone does not provide for his own family, and especially for his own household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a widow be put on the list if she is over sixty years old, has been a wife of one husband,
speaker: Narrator

text: and has a good reputation for doing good: if she brought up children, if she showed hospitality to strangers, if she washed the feet of the saints, if she provided help for those in distress, and if she dedicated herself to every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But do not put younger widows on the list, for when they have strong sensual desires that pull them away from Christ, they want to marry,
speaker: Narrator

text: and so they bring judgment on themselves because they set aside their former pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time, they also learn to be lazy as they go about from house to house. They not only learn to be lazy, but also to be gossips and busybodies, saying things that they should not say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I want younger widows to marry, to have children, to keep house, and to give no opportunity for the enemy to slander them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, some have already turned away to follow Satan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any believing woman has widows in her family, let her keep helping them rather than letting them become a burden to the church, so that the church may help those who are truly widows.
speaker: Narrator

text: The elders who lead well should be considered worthy of double honor, especially the ones who work hard in the word and doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Scripture says, “Do not muzzle the ox while it is treading out the grain,” and “The worker is worthy of his pay.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not accept an accusation against an elder, except on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the presence of everyone, rebuke the ones who persist in sin, so that the rest may be afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: I solemnly charge you, in the presence of God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels, that you follow these instructions without prejudice, doing nothing out of partiality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not lay hands on anyone hastily and do not take part in the sins of others. Keep yourself pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stop drinking just water, but use a little wine because of your stomach and your frequent sicknesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sins of some people are obvious, going on ahead of them to judgment, but the sins of others follow them there.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, good works are also obvious, and the ones that are not obvious cannot stay hidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who are under a yoke of slavery should consider their own masters worthy of all respect, so that God’s name and his teaching may not be blasphemed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And those who have believing masters should not be disrespectful toward them because they are brothers. Instead, they should serve them even better, because those who benefit from their good service are believers and dear to them.
Teach and urge these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone teaches different doctrines and does not devote himself to the sound words of our Lord Jesus Christ and to godly teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: he is puffed up with conceit and understands nothing. Instead, he has a morbid craving for controversies and battles over words, things that produce envy, strife, abusive language, evil suspicions,
speaker: Narrator

text: and constant frictions among people whose minds are depraved, who have lost hold of the truth, imagining that their godliness is a means of financial gain. Separate yourselves from such people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we brought nothing into the world, and we certainly cannot take anything out.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if we have food and clothing, with these we will be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who want to get rich fall into temptation and a trap and many foolish and harmful desires, which plunge them into complete destruction and utter ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of money is a root of all sorts of evils. By striving for money, some have wandered away from the faith and have pierced themselves with many pains.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, O man of God, flee from these things and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, perseverance, and gentleness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fight the good fight of faith. Take hold of eternal life, to which you were called and about which you made your good confession in the presence of many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: I charge you in the presence of God, who gives life to all things, and of Christ Jesus, who made a good confession as a witness before Pontius Pilate,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you keep this command without spot and without fault, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: which he will make known at the proper time—the blessed and only ruler, the King of kings and Lord of lords,
speaker: Narrator

text: who alone has immortality, who lives in unapproachable light, whom no one has seen or is able to see. To him be honor and power forever! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instruct those who are rich in this present age not to be arrogant or to put their hope in the uncertainty of riches, but rather in God, who richly supplies us with all things for our enjoyment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instruct them to do good, to be rich in good works, to be generous and willing to share.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way they are storing up for themselves the treasure of a good foundation for the future, so that they may take hold of that which is truly life.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Timothy, guard what has been entrusted to you, turning away from godless, empty talk and the contradictions of what is falsely called “knowledge.”
speaker: Narrator

text: By professing it, some have veered away from the faith. Grace be with you. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
